element.name: TChartArrow
element.short: Some elements of the chart, like an axis, can be decorated by an arrow

element.name: TChartArrow.Visible
element.short: Can be used to hide the arrow (if set to false).

element.name: TChartArrow.Inverted
element.short: Inverts the direction of the arrow
element.descr: The arrow at horizontal lines is normally drawn to point to the right, and the arrow at vertical lines drawn to point upward. With Inverted = true the arrow points to the left or downward, respectively.

element.name: TChartArrow.Draw
element.short: Draws the arrow at the specified position (in image coordinates) and using the specified pen.
element.descr: The direction of the line at which the arrow sits is given by the AAngle parameter (in radians).

element.name: TChartArrow.BaseLength
element.short: This is the length of the inner part of the arrow along the arrow direction

ul.li: When the BaseLength is 0 the arrow shape is like a thin wedge.
When the BaseLength is equal to Length the arrow shape is a triangle.
When Length > Baselength the end of the arrow head is concave, otherwise convex (like a rhombus).

element.name: TChartArrow.Width
element.short: The width of the arrow is measured perpendicular to the arrow direction

element.name: TChartArrow.Length
element.short: Defines the length of the outer part of the arrow

ul.li: When the BaseLength is 0 the arrow shape is like a thin wedge.
When the BaseLength is equal to Length the arrow shape is a triangle.
When Length > Baselength the end of the arrow head is concave, otherwise convex (like a rhombus).

element.name: TChartArrow.Create
element.short: Creates the arrow as an element of the specified chart

element.name: TChartArrow.Assign
element.short: Copies all properties from the arrow specified as ASource

element.name: TChartElement
element.short: Ancestor of the charrt elements (title, footer, axes, legend, etc.)

element.name: TChartElement.Create
element.short: Creates an instance of TChartElement as an element of the specified chart

element.name: TChartElement.SetOwner
element.short: Sets the owner of the element to the specified chart.
element.descr: The owner of the element receives the notification messages (StyleChanged ) when properties of the element are changed.

element.name: TChartElement.Visible
element.short: Can be set to false if the element is to be hidden.

element.name: TChartElement.Assign
element.short: Copies all property values from the given source.
element.descr: ASource must inherit from TChartElement, otherwise an exception will be raised.

element.name: TChartElement.GetOwner
element.short: Returns the Owner of the element
element.descr: The owner of the element receives the notification messages (StyleChanged ) when properties of the element are changed.

element.name: TChartElement.StyleChanged
element.short: Notifies the owner of the element whenever some property has been changed.

element.name: TChartElement.SetVisible
element.short: Setter procedure for the property Visible .

element.name: TChartElement.InitHelper
element.short: Initializes a TFPCanvasHelper used by the ChartElement.
element.descr: Font, Pen and Brush are the most prominent canvas helpers. The InitHelper procedure assigns the OnChanged event to the StyleChanged method which notifies the owner of the ChartElement when helper properties are modified.

element.name: TSeriesPointerStyle
element.short: Enumeration of symbols allowed as series pointers

element.name: TSeriesPointer.VertSize
element.short: Defines the vertical size of the pointer symbol (in image units)

element.name: TSeriesPointer.HorizSize
element.short: Defines the horizontal size of the pointer symbol (in image units)

element.name: TSeriesPointer.Brush
element.short: Defines the Brush used to fill the inner area of the series pointer

element.name: TSeriesPointer.Pen
element.short: Defines the Pen used to draw the border of the series pointer symbol

element.name: TSeriesPointer.Style
element.short: Determines the symbol used to draw the series pointer

element.name: TSeriesPointer.OverrideColor
element.short: Determines which colors will be used for drawing the SeriesPointer symbols

ul.li: When the element ocBrush is not included in the set then the symbol will be filled with the color of the series pointer's Brush , not with the color assigned to the individual data points.
When the element ocPen is not included in the set then the symbol border will be drawn with the color of the series pointer's Pen , not with the color assigned to the individual data points.
